sentences: Tamara Nikolayevna Guseva (born in Baku, 15 August 1926) was a Soviet classical pianist and People's Artist of Russia.
That same year Guseva won, ex-aequo with Yevgeny Malinin, the International Youth and Students Festival in Budapest.
She had previously been awarded a 4th prize at the 1945 All-Soviet Music Performance Competition.
Guseva served as Lev Oborin's assistant before being appointed a teacher at the Moscow Conservatory (1959â€“66).
During the 1950s she was a soloist at the newly founded Moscow Philharmonic Orchestra.
